body_html:
The metrics functions return two operations: one which computes the metrics based on the current value of a variable (with no dependency on its updating) and another which updates the variables and returns the computed value based on the new values. Your session.run call is running both of those, and the racy one can return different values.

Do _, e = tf.contrib.metrics... instead to always use the safe version.
body_text:
The metrics functions return two operations: one which computes the metrics based on the current value of a variable (with no dependency on its updating) and another which updates the variables and returns the computed value based on the new values. Your session.run call is running both of those, and the racy one can return different values.
Do _, e = tf.contrib.metrics... instead to always use the safe version.
body:
The metrics functions return two operations: one which computes the metrics based on the current value of a variable (with no dependency on its updating) and another which updates the variables and returns the computed value based on the new values. Your session.run call is running both of those, and the racy one can return different values.

Do `_, e = tf.contrib.metrics...` instead to always use the safe version.
